newsitem.title: USA: US CFTC gets injunction against Arizona firm.
newsitem.headline: US CFTC gets injunction against Arizona firm.

text.p: The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission said it obtained a preliminary injunction freezing the assets of United Metals Trading Corp, Western National Trading and two officials at the firms.

The CFTC and the Arizona Corporations Commission filed a 10-count civil complaint against the two firms and Marvin Pendergraft and Anthony Andrews, directors of United Metals and general partners in Western National.
The complaint alleges the defendants violated the anti-fraud provisions of the Commodity Exchange Act by engaging in a "Ponzi" scheme to defraud customers.
The injunction also prohibits the defendants from soliciting funds or destroying books and records, and requires each to make an accounting of their assets.
The CFTC said Pendergraft consented to the injunction and has been cooperating with investigators.
Litigation is continuing and the CFTC said it is seeking permanent injunctions in addition to other remedial relief such as disgorgement and civil monetary penalties.
